isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER RT-610 SERIES - REMOVE - RIGHT COUNTERSHAFT BEARINGS

step1.para: Remove the snap ring in the rear bearing bore of the case ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Remove Snap Ring in Rear Bearing Bore

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul against the rear of the countershaft to move the assembly forward as far as possible until the snap ring groove in the front bearing is exposed ( Figure 20).

note.para: If front bearing snap ring groove cannot be exposed (due to variances in the thickness of the case), use a punch between the hub of the countershaft drive gear and inner race of bearing to move the gear forward on the shaft.

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the exposed bearing snap ring groove ( Figure 21). (Use the snap ring which was removed from the rear bearing bore.)

figure.caption: Figure 21. Install Snap Ring in Exposed Bearing Snap Ring Groove

step1.para: Loosen the bolts at the bearing retaining rings on the auxiliary drive gear. This will allow movement to the rear of the countershaft and mainshaft assemblies ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Loosen Bolts at Bearing Retaining Rings

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul against the front of the countershaft to move the countershaft assembly to the rear as far as possible. This will move the front bearing forward on the shaft ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Move Countershaft Assembly to Rear

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul against the rear of the countershaft to move the countershaft as far forward as possible to unseat the front bearing from the case bore.
Use pullers or pry bars to remove the front bearing ( Figure 24).
Use a curved soft bar and maul from inside the case to move the rear countershaft bearing to the rear far enough to expose the snap ring groove in the rear bearing.
Install the snap ring in the groove in the rear bearing (same snap ring as used on the front bearing), and use pullers or pry bars to remove the countershaft rear bearing ( Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Install Snap Ring in Rear Bearing Groove
